Hey Josh,

Can you use gdb or the visual studio debugger to figure out what=
 section of code it is crashing on and why (from a syntactic point of view)=
 is it crashing?  It is important to know if it is because of a NULL pointe=
r, divide by zero, etc.. Also, it is crashing in the base NEAT code or in y=
our code?

If you are using unix/linux/mac, the code is already built with =
-pg, so if you usually run your program like this:
./Hypercube_NEAT -I myin=
put.dat -O myoutput.xml

You can run it under gdb like this:

gdb --args ./=
Hypercube_NEAT -I myinput.dat -O myoutput.xml

Then in the gdb prompt, type=
 "run" and it will begin executing under gdb.  When it crashes, type "bt" t=
o get a stack trace.  This is critical to figuring out why it is crashing.
=

Under visual studio, run in debug mode (hit 'f5') and the same thing shoul=
d happen when something crashes.

Jason G.



--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, =
